creator: xhhsld@gmail.com
text:
Now, in Jasper codes, it only supports jar URL and relative URL, that may be enough for common web applications. While, it is possible that the third-party uses other protocol URL, like file: protocol based URL. So, the JSP files will be always recompiled for each access for the target page.
The codes are located in Compiler.isOutDated() method.
Is it possible to provide more generic handlering for the URL ?

creator: knst.kolinko@gmail.com
text:

handle file:/

creator: viola.lu@gmail.com
viola.lu@gmail.com
text: Now compile only handles taglib jar file as jar:/file:/***.jar!/META-INF/taglib.tld or /WEB-INF/taglib.tld, but if tag lib file exists as expanded folder for example: file:/***.jar/META-INF/taglib.tld, Compiler.isOutDated() will return true and compile jsp always. So provide this patch to make it can handle file:/ URL also

creator: markt@apache.org
text: Thanks for the patch. It has been applied to trunk and 7.0.x and will be included in 7.0.30 onwards.
